tags: Curt Teich Postcard Archives Digital Collection
description: First Street. Albuquerque has a population of 25,000; the largest lumber manufacturing industry of the Southwest; the largest tie treating plant in the world, fifty miles of railway terminals; large woolen mills; large wool-scouring mills; fifty miles of graded streets; and over six miles of trolley lines. It is a clean well-governed, growing city, and is the financial and commercial center of New Mexico. Altitude 5,000 feet.
